page.title: 10HOUSING
page.content: Nearly all of the houses in Treburrick had only been built about 2 years ago.Some were used as holiday flats. The roofs of the houses were mainly made from tiles or slate. There were no thatched roofs around. The oldest house we came across was 400 year old. In Penrose the surroundings were horrible. It was very junky and the cottages wer all mouldy with oldness.One house had a roof that was part Cornish slate and part tile. One of the houses in Pwnrose used to be the village Post Office. Then it was made into a Tailor shop.In Penrose most of the houses were fairly old. At the top end of the village were 4 council houses.They were build at the end of the war in about 1944-45;the roofs were made of concrete tiles.
